title: Seafood Chowder
summary: You can never have too many soup recipes, so give Seafood Chowder a try. One portion of this dish contains roughly 4g of protein, 22g of fat, and a total of 315 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.18 per serving. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up half & half, red-skinned potatoes, canolan oil, and a few other things to make it today. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegetarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 27%. This score is rather bad. Try Seafood Chowder Pot Pie, Seafood Chowder, and BC Seafood Chowder for similar recipes.
instructions: Directions1In a medium-large pot set over medium heat, melt the oil and butter together and saute the onion for about 5 minutes, until soft but not golden. Add the thyme and bay leaf and cook for another minute. Add the potatoes, corn and stock - make sure there is enough liquid to cover the potatoes - if not, add a little more water until it does.2Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the potatoes are tender. Dump in the seafood and stir until it turns opaque - this should only take a couple of minutes. Don't overcook the shrimp, or they will curl up and get tough. Stir in the cream and season with salt and pepper.3Divide among bowls and sprinkle with parlsey or chives.Makes:  Serves 4(ish).

steps.step: Add the thyme and bay leaf and cook for another minute.
